metadata.title: CVE-2019-19319 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel before 5.2, a setxattr operation, after a mount of acrafted ext4 image, can cause a slab-out-of-bounds write access because ofan ext4_xattr_set_entry use-after-free in fs/ext4/xattr.c when a largeold_size value is used in a memset call, aka CID-345c0dbf3a30.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
